intro: Vincetoxicum stocksii, commonly known as the creeping stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Vincetoxicum stocksii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
